## Welcome

Thank you for visiting my personal website detailing my research interests and work. This website contains a collection of my work and other research resources.

## Biography

Seungju Kim[^1] (he/him) is a **National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellow** and first-year PhD student in Clinical/Community Psychology at the University of Illinois. His research explores how religiosity and spirituality influence biases, empathy, and health disparities in privileged and marginalized communities.

[^1]: Click [here](https://www.name-coach.com/seungju-kim) to learn how to pronounce my name

## Research Interests

Using advanced statistical techniques, Seungju aims to uncover insights that can inform religious leaders, clinicians, and community researchers in their approach to caring for marginalized groups. His work spans multiple areas, including:

-   LGBTQ+/SGM

-   BIPOC

-   Suicide, substance use, and depression

-   Religiosity/spirituality

-   Network Analysis

-   Structural Equation Modeling
